column1: Only once during those dreary three hundred years did the children of Lîr see any of their friends. When they saw
column2: riding down to the shore at the mouth of the Bann on the north coast of Erin
column6: the swans hastened to meet them. And glad were their hearts that day
column7: for the company was led by two sons of Bodb the Red
column8: who had searched for the swans along the rocky coast of Erin for many a day
column9: and who brought them loving greetings from the good king of the Dedannans and from their father Lîr.At length the three hundred years on the Sea of Moyle came to an end
column10: and the swans flew to Ivros Domnann and the Isle of Glora in the western sea.
